com.jogamp.opengl.util.av

Interface AudioSink


  • public interface AudioSink

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  AudioSink.AudioDataFormat
      Specifies the audio data format.
      static class  AudioSink.AudioDataType
      Specifies the audio data type.
      static class  AudioSink.AudioFrame 

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static boolean DEBUG 
      static AudioSink.AudioDataFormat DefaultFormat
      Default AudioSink.AudioDataFormat, [type PCM, sampleRate 44100, sampleSize 16, channelCount 2, signed, littleEndian].

    • Method Summary

    • Field Detail

      • DEBUG

        static final boolean DEBUG

      • DefaultFormat

        static final AudioSink.AudioDataFormat DefaultFormat
        Default AudioSink.AudioDataFormat, [type PCM, sampleRate 44100, sampleSize 16, channelCount 2, signed, littleEndian].

    • Method Detail

      • isInitialized

        boolean isInitialized()
        Returns the initialized state of this instance.

        The initialized state is affected by this instance overall availability, i.e. after instantiation, as well as by destroy().

      • getPreferredFormat

        AudioSink.AudioDataFormat getPreferredFormat()
        Returns the preferred AudioSink.AudioDataFormat by this sink.

        The preferred format shall reflect this sinks most native format, i.e. best performance w/o data conversion.

        See Also:
        #initSink(AudioDataFormat)

      • initSink

        AudioSink.AudioDataFormat initSink(AudioSink.AudioDataFormat requestedFormat,
                                 int bufferCount)
        Initializes the sink.

        Implementation shall try to match the given requestedFormat AudioSink.AudioDataFormat as close as possible, regarding it's capabilities.

        A user may consider getPreferredFormat() and pass this value to utilize best performance and behavior.

        The DefaultFormat should be supported by all implementations.

        Parameters:
        requestedFormat - the requested AudioSink.AudioDataFormat.
        bufferCount - number of buffers for sink
        Returns:
        if successful the chosen AudioDataFormat based on the requestedFormat and this sinks capabilities, otherwise null.

      • destroy

        void destroy()
        Destroys this instance, i.e. closes all streams and devices allocated.

      • getQueuedByteCount

        int getQueuedByteCount()
        Returns the number of bytes queued for playing.

        #initSink(AudioDataFormat) must be called first.

      • getQueuedTime

        int getQueuedTime()
        Returns the queued buffer time in milliseconds for playing.

        #initSink(AudioDataFormat) must be called first.

      • getWritableBufferCount

        int getWritableBufferCount()
        Returns the number of buffers in the sink available for writing.

        #initSink(AudioDataFormat) must be called first.

      • isDataAvailable

        boolean isDataAvailable(int data_size)
        Returns true if data is available to be written in the sink.

        #initSink(AudioDataFormat) must be called first.

      • writeData

        void writeData(AudioSink.AudioFrame audioFrame)
        Writes the remaining bytes of the given direct ByteBuffer to this sink.

        The data must comply with the chosen AudioSink.AudioDataFormat as returned by #initSink(AudioDataFormat).
